channel.title: XBox Live (360)
channel.description:
Well my friend told me you get 3 months (or something) of live if you buy a 360, but when i try to connect it says disconnected, he said i need to plug my 360 into my router.
But I am using a wireless linksys router, anyone here play live with wireless routers that could help me?

item.title: XBox Live (360)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:20, topic:168574”][quote author=mrrules link=topic=228178.msg1959430#msg1959430 date=1198900673]
If you have wireless internet computer near your xbox you can plug the lan cord from your xbox into your computer , then go to your wireless connection properties and to advanced tab and tick the box were it says allow other something something… if you need help or me to walk you though it let me know. This can pretty much save you 100 so you don’t have to buy the wireless card for the xbox. All you need is a computer with wireless internet near your xbox.

[/quote]
thanks, but i already connected. The only problem i have now i that it says ‘xbox live signup is not available at the time’.

update worked, seems the wire in my pc unplugged and maid it fail, Its half way done and literally dancing because i made some progress

Xbox live signup is not available at this time.

Well, you’re going through a rough time.
Obviously it wasn’t meant to be.

Just keep trying?

Nothing better to do

EDIT: Worked, now its asking for my gamertag, where do i get it?[/quote]

You make one…and thuglife is right about the wire and wireless…somewhat lags more if your on wireless.

Also Casey it is 3 or 4months…Since you can make new account 3 or 4 times for the 1 month free thing…before you cant.

Read full topic

If you have wireless internet computer near your xbox you can plug the lan cord from your xbox into your computer , then go to your wireless connection properties and to advanced tab and tick the box were it says allow other something something… if you need help or me to walk you though it let me know. This can pretty much save you 100 so you don’t have to buy the wireless card for the xbox. All you need is a computer with wireless internet near your xbox.

item.title: XBox Live (360)
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:8, topic:168574”]Well this is just a little advise, when i had my xbox 360 (because i had some spare money and decided to get that while i waited for the ps3 release), before i bought the wireless adapter i just plugged it into my router and it ran fine but i thought i would get a wireless adapter to get rid of the long wire across my room and the quality is no where near as good as it was when i ran it through the wire.

I got little jumps and lags, odd disconnections when running it through the wireless adapter, when running it through the wire it ran perfect.
I got pretty much the same with the inbuilt wireless feature in the ps3, so i run that through a wire instead.

So if you ask me its best if you save your $100 and run xbl through a wire to your router.[/quote]

I dont have any problems with my wireless.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Live (360)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Cruzer:

The adapter is 100$ works well. You can also just plug it into your router via the included network cable.

just did that, ip address failed, then my dad did something and now everything is confirmed. But it asks me for an update and its taking forever.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Live (360)
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well this is just a little advise, when i had my xbox 360 (because i had some spare money and decided to get that while i waited for the ps3 release), before i bought the wireless adapter i just plugged it into my router and it ran fine but i thought i would get a wireless adapter to get rid of the long wire across my room and the quality is no where near as good as it was when i ran it through the wire.

I got little jumps and lags, odd disconnections when running it through the wireless adapter, when running it through the wire it ran perfect.
I got pretty much the same with the inbuilt wireless feature in the ps3, so i run that through a wire instead.

So if you ask me its best if you save your $100 and run xbl through a wire to your router.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Live (360)
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:168574”][quote author=Casey. link=topic=228178.msg1959005#msg1959005 date=1198892416]
I just got live and I asked about the same thing.

I have wireless as well, and the guy said I would need to buy a wireless adapter for it(which runs around 100)

Also, its one month.
[/quote]
alright, how much are these adapters? And so i just plug it in, and when i select live it will use the adapter to find a wireless network?[/quote]
I forgot to mention, I didn’t get it lol. I just run it off my dsl box or w/e on my computer.
It should run around 100{or so the dude at eb games said} so just call and ask them lol

Read full topic
